    <set>
    color = 'red'
    </set>
)

let age: number = 37;
let sentence: string = `Hello, my name is${fullName}`;
let sentence: string =  (
    <set>
    "Hello, my name is " + fullName + ".\n\n" + "I'll be " + (age + 1) + " years old next month."
    </set>
)
;

    }

Optional parameters

   1 function buildName
   2     param firstName
   3         :string
   4     param
   5         :string
   6         :optional
   7     if lastName
   8         return firstName + " " + lastName
   9     else
  10         return firstName

    
function buildName(firstName: string, : string) {
    if (lastName) {
        return firstName + " " + lastName;
    }
    else {
        return firstName;
    }
}

This and arrow functions

   1 let deck
   2     {
   3         [ suits
   4             @ "hearts"
   5             @ "spades"
   6             @ "clubs"
   7             @ "diamonds"
   8         @ cards Array(52)
   9         @ createCardPicker
  10             function
  11                 return
  12                     function
  13                         let pickedCard = Math.floor(Math.random() * 52)
  14                         let pickedSuit = Math.floor(pickedCard / 13)
  15                         return
  16                             {
  17                                 @ suit this.suits[pickedSuit]
  18                                 @ card pickedCard % 13

    
let deck = {
    suits: [
        "hearts", 
        "spades", 
        "clubs", 
        "diamonds"
    ], 
    cards: Array(52), 
    createCardPicker: function() {
        return function() {
                let pickedCard = Math.floor(Math.random() * 52);
                let pickedSuit = Math.floor(pickedCard / 13);
                return {
                        suit: this.suits[pickedSuit], 
                        card: pickedCard % 13
                    };
            };
    }
};
let deck = {
    suits: [
        "hearts", 
        "spades", 
        "clubs", 
        "diamonds"
    ], 
    cards: Array(52), 
    createCardPicker: function() {
        // NOTE: the line below is now an arrow function, allowing us to capture 'this' right here
        return () => {
                let pickedCard = Math.floor(Math.random() * 52);
                let pickedSuit = Math.floor(pickedCard / 13);
                return {
                        suit: this.suits[pickedSuit], 
                        card: pickedCard % 13
                    };
            };
    }
};

    addClickListener(onclick: (this: void, e: Event)): void;
}
class Handler {
    info: string;
    onClickBad(this: Handler, e: Event) {
         (
            <set>
            this.info = e.message
            </set>
        )
    }
}

Overloads 1

   1 let suits
   2     [
   3         @ "hearts"
   4         @ "spades"
   5         @ "clubs"
   6         @ "diamonds"

    
let suits = [
    "hearts", 
    "spades", 
    "clubs", 
    "diamonds"
];
function pickCard(x):  any {
    if (typeof x == "object") {
        let pickedCard = Math.floor(Math.random() * x.length);
        return pickedCard;
    }
    else {
        // Otherwise just let them pick the card
        if (typeof x == "number") {
            let pickedSuit = Math.floor(x / 13);
            return {
                    suit: suits[pickedSuit], 
                    card: x % 13
                };
        }
    }
}

Overloads 2

   1 let suits
   2     [
   3         @ "hearts"
   4         @ "spades"
   5         @ "clubs"
   6         @ "diamonds"

    
let suits = [
    "hearts", 
    "spades", 
    "clubs", 
    "diamonds"
];
function pickCard(x: {suit: string;
    card: number;
}[]):  number;
function pickCard(x: number):  {suit: string;
    ;
    card: number;
    function pickCard(x}):  any {
    // if so, they gave us the deck and we'll pick the card
    if (typeof x == "object") {
        let pickedCard = Math.floor(Math.random() * x.length);
        return pickedCard;
    }
    else {
        // Otherwise just let them pick the card
        if (typeof x == "number") {
            let pickedSuit = Math.floor(x / 13);
            return {
                    suit: suits[pickedSuit], 
                    card: x % 13
                };
        }
    }
}

Simple class

   1 class Greeter
   2     p greeting
   3         :string
   4     ctor
   5         param message
   6             :string
   7         set this.greeting = message
   8     m greet
   9         return "Hello, " + this.greeting

    
class Greeter {
    constructor(message: string) { (
            <set>
            this.greeting = message
            </set>
        )
    }
    greeting: string;
    greet() {
        return "Hello, " + this.greeting;
    }
}
let greeter = new Greeter("world");

   1 class Animal

   8                 + Animal moved
   9                 @ distanceInMeters
  10                 + m.

    move( = 0) {
        console.log(`Animal moved${distanceInMeters}m.`);
    }
}
class Dog extends Animal {
    bark() {
        console.log('Woof! Woof!');
    }
}

Complex class example

   1 class Animal
   2     p name
   3         :string
   4     ctor
   5         param theName
   6             :string
   7         set this.name = theName
   8     m move
   9         param distanceInMeters
  10             :number
  11             := 0
  12         _ console.log
  13             `lit
  14                 +
  15                 @ this.name
  16                 + moved
  17                 @ distanceInMeters
  18                 + m.

    
class Animal {
    constructor(theName: string) { (
            <set>
            this.name = theName
            </set>
        )
    }
    name: string;
    move( = 0) {
        console.log(`${this.name}moved${distanceInMeters}m.`);
    }
}
class Snake extends Animal {
    constructor(name: string) {super(name);
    }
    move(distanceInMeters = 5) {
        console.log("Slithering...");
        super.move(distanceInMeters);
    }
}
class Horse extends Animal {
    constructor(name: string) {super(name);
    }
    move(distanceInMeters = 45) {
        console.log("Galloping...");
        super.move(distanceInMeters);
    }
}

         (

            this.department = department
            </set>
        )
    }
    department: string;
    getElevatorPitch() {
        return `Hello, my name is${this.name}and I work in${this.department}.`;
    }
}

Static members

   1 class Grid
   2     p origin
   3         static
   4         {
   5             @ x 0
   6             @ y 0
   7     m calculateDistanceFromOrigin
   8         param point
   9             :{
  10                 :p x
  11                     :number
  12                 :p y
  13                     :number
  14         let xDist = (point.x - Grid.origin.x)
  15         let yDist = (point.y - Grid.origin.y)
  16         return Math.sqrt(xDist * xDist + yDist * yDist) / this.scale

    
class Grid {
    static originorigin: {
            {
                x: 0, 
                y: 0calculateDistanceFromOrigin(point: {x: number;
                    
                }y: number;
                
            }
    }) {
        let xDist = (point.x - Grid.origin.x);
        let yDist = (point.y - Grid.origin.y);
        return Math.sqrt(xDist * xDist + yDist * yDist) / this.scale;
    }
}

             void
        }

    constructor() {super("Accounting and Auditing");
    }

        console.log("The Accounting Department meets each Monday at 10am.");

Static members

   1 class Greeter
   2     p standardGreeting
   3         static
   4         := "Hello, there"
   5     p greeting
   6         :string
   7     m greet
   8         if this.greeting
   9             return "Hello, " + this.greeting
  10         else
  11             return Greeter.standardGreeting

    
class Greeter {
    static standardGreeting = "Hello, there";
    greeting: string;
    greet() {
        if (this.greeting) {
            return "Hello, " + this.greeting;
        }
        else {
            return Greeter.standardGreeting;
        }
    }
}

Class extended by interface

   1 class Point
   2     p x
   3         :number
   4     p y
   5         :number

    
class Point {
    x: number;
    y: number;
}
interface Point3d implements Point {
    z: number;
}
let point3d: Point3d = {
    x: 1, 
    y: 2, 
    z: 3
};

interface SquareConfig {
    color?: string;
    width?: number;
}
function createSquare(config: SquareConfig):  {color: string;
     {
        let newSquare = {
            color: "white"area: number;
            , 
            area: 100}
    };
    if (config.color) {
         (
            <set>
            newSquare.color = config.color
            </set>
        )
    }
    if (config.width) {
         (
            <set>
            newSquare.area = config.width * config.width
            </set>
        )
    }
    return newSquare;
}
let mySquare = createSquare({
    color: "black"
});

function createSquare(config: SquareConfig):  {color: string;
     {
        let newSquare = {
            color: "white"area: number;
            , 
            area: 100}
    };
    if (config.clor) {
        // Error: Property 'clor' does not exist on type 'SquareConfig'
         (
            <set>
            newSquare.color = config.clor
            </set>
        )
    }
    if (config.width) {
         (
            <set>
            newSquare.area = config.width * config.width
            </set>
        )
    }
    return newSquare;
}

   1 :interface ClockConstructor

interface ClockConstructor {
    *** :new ;
}
class Clock implements ClockConstructor {
    constructor(h: number, m: number) {}
    currentTime: Date;
}
interface ClockConstructor {
    *** :new ;
}
interface ClockInterface {
    tick();
}
function createClock(ctor: ClockConstructor, hour: number, minute: number):  ClockInterface {
    return new ctor(hour, minute);
}
class DigitalClock implements ClockInterface {
    constructor(h: number, m: number) {}
    tick() {
        console.log("beep beep");
    }
}
class AnalogClock implements ClockInterface {
    constructor(h: number, m: number) {}
    tick() {
        console.log("tick tock");
    }
}
let digital = createClock(DigitalClock, 12, 17);
let analog = createClock(AnalogClock, 7, 32);

   1 function padLeft
   2     param value
   3         :string
   4     param padding
   5         :any
   6     if typeof padding === "number"
   7         return Array(padding + 1).join(" ") + value
   8     if typeof padding === "string"
   9         return padding + value
  10     throw
  11         new Error
  12             `lit
  13                 + Expected string or number, got '
  14                 @ padding
  15                 + '.

    
function padLeft(value: string, padding: any) {
    if (typeof padding === "number") {
        return Array(padding + 1).join(" ") + value;
    }
    if (typeof padding === "string") {
        return padding + value;
    }
    throw new Error(`Expected string or number, got '${padding}'.`);
}
padLeft("Hello world", 4);
let indentedString = padLeft("Hello world", true);
function padLeft(value: string, padding: string | number) {
}
let indentedString = padLeft("Hello world", true);
interface Bird {
    fly();
    layEggs();
}
interface Fish {
    swim();
    layEggs();
}
function getSmallPet():  Fish | Bird {
}
let pet = getSmallPet();
pet.layEggs();
pet.swim();

function f(sn: string | null):  string {
    if (sn == null) {
        return "default";
    }
    else {
        return sn;
    }
}
function f(sn: string | null):  string {
    return sn || "default";
}
function broken(name: string | null):  string {
    function postfix(epithet: string) {
        return name.charAt(0) + '.  the ' + epithet;
    }
     (
        <set>
        name = name || "Bob"
        </set>
    )
    return postfix("great");
}

        return ((().charAt(0)
            ) + '.  the ') + epithet;
    }
     (
        <set>
        name = name || "Bob"
        </set>
    )

Type Aliases

   1 :type Name
   2     :string

    
type Name = string;
type NameResolver = ();
type NameOrResolver = Name | NameResolver;
function getName(n: NameOrResolver):  Name {
    if (typeof n === "string") {
        return n;
    }
    else {
        return n();
    }
}
type Container<T> = {value: T;
};
type Tree<T> = {value: T;
    left: <Tree>T;
    right: <Tree>T;
};

    ;

    name: string;

Interfaces vs.Type Aliases

   1 :type Alias
   2     :{
   3         :p num
   4             :number

    
type Alias = {num: number;
};
interface Interface {
    num: number;
}
function aliased(arg: Alias):  Alias;
function interfaced(arg: Interface):  Interface;

interface Square {
    kind: "square";
    size: number;
}
interface Rectangle {
    kind: "rectangle";
    width: number;
    height: number;
}
interface Circle {
    kind: "circle";
    radius: number;
}
type Shape = Square | Rectangle | Circle;
function area(s: Shape) {
     (
        <switch>
        s.kind
        case "square": {
            return s.size * s.size;
        }
        case "rectangle": {
            return s.height * s.width;
        }
        case "circle": {
            return Math.PI * s.radius ** 2;
        }
        </switch>
    )
}

        }

function assertNever( = never):  never {
    throw new Error("Unexpected object: " + x);
}
function area(s: Shape) {
     (
        <switch>
        s.kind
        case "square": {
            return s.size * s.size;
        }
        case "rectangle": {
            return s.height * s.width;
        }
        case "circle": {
            return Math.PI * s.radius ** 2;
        }
        default: {
            return assertNever(s);
        }
        </switch>
    )
}

   1 class BasicCalculator

  18         param operand

class BasicCalculator {
    constructor( = 0) {}
    currentValue() {
        return this.value;
    }
    add(operand: number) {
         (
            <set>
            this.value += operand
            </set>
        )
        return this;
    }
    multiply(operand: number) {
         (
            <set>
            this.value *= operand
            </set>
        )
        return this;
    }
}
let v = new BasicCalculator(2).multiply(5).add(1).currentValue();
class ScientificCalculator extends BasicCalculator {
    constructor(value = 0) {super(value);
    }
    sin() {
         (
            <set>
            this.value = Math.sin(this.value)
            </set>
        )
        return this;
    }
}
let v = new ScientificCalculator(2).multiply(5).sin().add(1).currentValue();

function pluck(o, names) {
    return names.map((n) =>
            o[n]);
}
function pluck<T, K keyof T>(o: T, names: K[]):  T[K][] {
    return names.map((n) =>
            o[n]);
}

    name: string;
    age: number;

    'unknown'

}
